cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government)
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 11th JUNE, 1918.
1. Last night the French retook MERY. In order to shorten their line, the French have evacuated the NAMPCEL -PONTOISE - SEMPIGNY - MONTIGNY salient. Their line now runs approximately as follows: AUTRECHE - MOULIN-SOUS-TOUVENT - TRACY-LE-MONT - BAILLY - thence along the southern bank of the OISE to about BETHANCOURT, thence North of MARCHEMONT - through MAREST-SUR-MATZ - ANTHEUIL -North of GOURMAY-SUR-ARONDE - MERY - COURCELLES - D0NFR0NT -LE MONCHEL.
2. On the rest of the front there is no change.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
11th June, 1918.
Issued at 12.30 p.m.
For the personal information of the Minister only.
